alert.note: Alert for Long (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 1:06PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Long. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected in much of the advisory area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have already fallen in some areas, mainly west and east of Ludowici. - Runoff from earlier rainfall as well as possible additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches will likely result in minor flooding in some areas. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Ludowici, Tibet, Murrays Crossing, Donald and Jones Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
